text: From tap at MBCC 2017. A reddish coloured beer with a small pink head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, fruit, hops and cherries.

Draught @ MBCC 2017. Pours red with an offwhite head. Aroma of light sourness, yeast, wood, rich tart fruit, raspberry, cherries. Flavor is sour, yeast, wood, rich tart fruit, raspberry and cherry. Medium body, average carbonation, acidic finish. 130517
MBCC. Hazy deep red with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, cherries, raspberries and tart. Flavor is quite sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 130517

Tap @ MBBC, Copenhagen, 2017. Pours hazy reddish with a small off white head. Berries and cherries - intense. Slight stomach acid, vomit and barnyard. But the fruit is jammy as what and soo lovely and intense.
Bottle at cbc17 Green.. M deep red... No head.. N. S dry berries fruit nose. Tart Berries. Ling sour tartnes
Bottle @MBCC2017, Green Session. Clear red, small white head. Strong raspberry aroma. Sour raspberries, light funk.
Tap @ MBC 2017. Pours deep reddish with a white head. Aroma of huge cherry, raspberries, fruity, funky, slight vinegar, jammy. Loads of tart raspberries, fresh berries, funky.

Fat på MBCC 2017. Klarröd i färgen. Stor sötsyrlig doft av körsbärslikör, körsbärskärnor, hallon, hallonkärnor och körsbärssylt/saft. Stor, djup smak med ganska stor syra. Körsbär, halm, körsbärskaramell, ek, nästan lite godis. Söt.
Provad på MBCC-17. Fin djup rosaföd färg. Hallon, inbär, moreller, lite kärnor, mandel, ganska stram med lite tanniner, torr. Riktigt gott.

Pours milky raspberry with a low white head. Aromas of raspberries, lactose, red currants. Taste is fruity and floral with light grassy notes. Mouthfeel is light bodied with moderate carbonation and quite dry with medium carbonation.
Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Green Session. Klare rötlich pinke Farbe. Geruch nach Kirschen, mild säuerlich fruchtig, Joghurt. Geschmack ist sauer fruchtig, Kirschen, trocken holzig.

Pours cloudy raspberry with low white head 
Aromas tart of cherries, raspberry , hints of baking soda, over ripe apples 
Taste has tart notes of cherries, raspberry, red currant, green apples, grapes
Pours hazy reddish with low pink head. Aroma of red currant, cherry, raspberry, berries. Taste is rich berry tart with a mellow berry sweet finish. Light and smooth body with average carbonation.
75 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden red with a small white head. Aroma is almondish and cherry fruity. Dry, almondish. Lingering citric and dry wooden. Dry and cherry fruity far finish.
dark red with a thin head. Aroma is straight up raspberry jam. Very fruity on the tongue, loads of berries. Jammy mouthfeel. Sour dry finish. Nice one.
500ml bottle shared. Dark ruby pour. Aroma is funky raspberry, slight cherry. Great combo of fruits, tart as hell but crazy good. I love de garde!
Bomber shared by Tom - thanks! Deep purple pour with a white head. Dark cherry and raspberry. Tart as fuck. Awesome!

Hazy red color with pink head. Aroma is fruity but there is also some funk going on, a bit "dirty" and rustic. Taste is really fruity, tart, lots of sour cherries, dry on the finish. Light body, medium carbonation, dry on the finish. Overall a really well made sour with lots of fruits and some yeast funk.

Bottle shared at a tasting. Hazy ruby pour with a thin pink head. Notes of raspberries, tons of sour cherries, minerals, blueberries, very tart forest fruit. Way too tart, but otherwise the flavours are all there.

Bottle at a tasting. Hazy reddish purple in appearance with a small light pinkish head. The aroma is nice sour cherry, oak, funkiness, raspberry. The flavor is nicely tart, jammy, red berries and fruits, sour cherry, lactic. Has a good biting feel and is well carbonated. Very solid.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy purple with small pinkish white head that lasts. The aroma is strong funk, oak, berry, cherry. Thick body, jammy, acidic, berry, strong funk, oak, light dry finish, very nice.
Shared bottle. Pours a dark reddish purple with a decent pinkish head. Aroma of fruit and funk. Taste is raspberries, cherries, funk, and oak. Excellent.
[1/27/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at a bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Deep red-purple. Cherries, berries, juicy, lacto, oak, funk.

From bottle. Ruby red color with pinkish head. Malty and yeasty aroma, tart fruity, light funky, wood, sugar notes. sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Light to medium almost oily body with soft carbonation.

Sample at the "Northeastern vs Northwestern Brewery Tasting" on 10/29/2016. Hazy purplish-red color with a medium pinkish-white head that evaporates steadily to a film. Stringy lacing. Aroma of tart cherry, yeast and malt. Tart and oaky character with notes of cherry, berries, yeast and bready malt. The finish is tart and fruity with a raspberry and cherry aftertaste. Enjoyable beer all around.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy dark pink with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of pithy cherries, light tartness and some funk. Flavour is very tart, with super dry tart cherries, barnyard funk, and legit acidity. Wonderfully balanced and complex. Excellent.
UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 ,Pours deep purplish color with no head. Raspberry jam nose. Slight Cinnamon and cherry put flavor. Above average carbonation.

Poured into a snifter showing unfiltered hazy purple and red with no head. 

The nose shows a lot of brett with a moderately intense kriek note throughout. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Highly tart with flavors of bright cherries with a strong breath of oak in the finish. Superb.

750ml bottle from Saturday night share. Pours out a deep violet body with lighter pink head. Fruity aroma, equal parts cherries and berries. Taste starts with a bit of pucker, still carrying through on the fruit sweetness. Kind of sweet and dry finish.

750ml bottle pours out a sexy purple pink topped with a small head. Nose is amazing raspberry cherries big tartness and sweet kick. Taste is more of big fruit notes some raspberry seed ting and a great end.

Dangerous Bottleshares XL forealz edition. Pours deep unclear cloudy blood red. Aroma is extremely jammy and juicy with notes of raspberries, cherries, marzipan, slight raspberries, sour candy and slight lactic tartness. The taste is fruity with jammy and juicy notes. Tart lactic notes, sour candy and very sour raspberries.

Pour murky dark ruby red, with as good as no head, but has a thin pink ring as head. 
Aroma is pretty darn juicy red berry forward, plenty of raspberry juice, pretty darn tart, lemon juice, ascorbic acid, sour sweets. 
Taste is pretty darn lactic sour, with a whole lot of fruity sweetness to it, but is dominantly sour. 
Medium bodied, with a really lively carbonation. Pretty delicious. Thanks a bunch Aaron

Bottle @ Killem All 2016 thanks to Aaron. Pours deep bloody red with a small pink head. Aromas of sweet jammy cherries, marzipan, subtle tannic, raspberry pits, hard candies, lactic, classic de garde WA funk. Taste has sour cherries, marzipan, raspberry pits, jam, lactic,

Bottle thanks to Aaron at Dangerous Bottleshares XL 4Realz Edition Motherbrother, Hoprider and Aaron. Pours a dark, murky purple/bordeaux with a tiny, pink head. Aroma is suuuuper jammy, black cherries, raspberry, slight lactic, vanilla, juicy, oak, de garde funk. Taste is super tart, pithy raspberry tart/bitterness, slight oily marzian-cherry-sweetish notes, dry and oaky finish. Average low carbonation, but a prickly tart body.

Pours deep ruby with a small pinkish head. Rich candied cherries and a little framboos behind it. Both wildly candied sour but also almondy whiffs. Lovely cherry jam in the taste. Citrus juices too. Big raspberry flavours on the palate as well. So intense and juicy in the finish and getting slightly dry in the aftertaste. Great stuff!

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares XL feat. Motherbrother, hoprider and FranzBC. Dark red hazy pour with a tiny head. Tons of cherries, cherry pipes, light almonds, marzipan, some jammy raspberries, funk, light citric and a medium tartness.

Bottle; Pour is murky red/violet - but purple sounds better than red/violet - either way- gawd damn. The nose is cherry juice and skins, raspberry tart - as well as lemon rind presence. The carbonation is limited and fades to oblivion rather quickly. The flavor profile feels like De Garde - which means Im becoming familiar with the terroir of their product. Its acidic, sweet tart - cherry/raspberry fusion , moving to a musty, grassy, dry finish line. Moar, please.

Bottle shared by "AKFaust". Colour...well...not purple, which is what I expected, but a lovely, hazy, dark pink with a thin head. Nose...yup! Raspberries and cherries. Nuf said. Palate...my! This is a tangy, zippy wench! Gobs of crushed raspberries and macerated cherries with zippy, yeasty notes and a grippingly tight mouthfeel. The mid palate is sappy and the finish is long and sunny.
